chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
P: nat -> Prop

Goal:
(forall x : nat, P x \/ ~ P x) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> exists n : nat, P n /\ (forall i : nat, i < n -> ~ P i)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
bounded_min : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall x : nat, P x \/ ~ P x) -> forall n : nat, (exists k : nat, k < n /\ P k /\ (forall i : nat, i < k -> ~ P i)) \/ (forall k : nat, k < n -> ~ P k)
dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> has_unique_least_element le P
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
between_not_exists : forall (P Q : nat -> Prop) (k l : nat), between P k l -> (forall n : nat, in_int k l n -> P n -> ~ Q n) -> ~ exists_between Q k l
between_ind : forall (P : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) (P0 : nat -> Prop), P0 k -> (forall l : nat, between P k l -> P0 l -> P l -> P0 (S l)) -> forall n : nat, between P k n -> P0 n
le_lt_or_eq : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> n < m \/ n = m
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
lt_n_Sm_le : forall n m : nat, n < S m -> n <= m
list_choose_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall ll : list X, {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}} + {forall x : X, In x ll -> ~ P x}
Inductive between (P : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) : nat -> Prop := bet_emp : between P k k | bet_S : forall l : nat, between P k l -> P l -> between P k (S l) Arguments between _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments bet_emp _%function_scope _%nat_scope Arguments bet_S _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
reflect_ind : forall (P : Prop) (P0 : forall b : bool, reflect P b -> Prop), (forall p : P, P0 true (ReflectT P p)) -> (forall n : ~ P, P0 false (ReflectF P n)) -> forall (b : bool) (r : reflect P b), P0 b r
reflect_sind : forall (P : Prop) (P0 : forall b : bool, reflect P b -> SProp), (forall p : P, P0 true (ReflectT P p)) -> (forall n : ~ P, P0 false (ReflectF P n)) -> forall (b : bool) (r : reflect P b), P0 b r
reflect_rect : forall (P : Prop) (P0 : forall b : bool, reflect P b -> Type), (forall p : P, P0 true (ReflectT P p)) -> (forall n : ~ P, P0 false (ReflectF P n)) -> forall (b : bool) (r : reflect P b), P0 b r
neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ Forall P l -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
Exists_exists : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Exists P l < -> (exists x : A, In x l /\ P x)
Nat.le_neq : forall n m : nat, n < m < -> n <= m /\ n <> m
list_first_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall (a : X) (ll : list X), P a -> In a ll -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}}
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_lt : forall n m : nat, n < m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
Forall_Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {Forall P l} + {Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l}
le_S : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m
Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, In x l -> P x)
BinNums.positive_ind : forall P : BinNums.positive -> Prop, (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xI p)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xO p)) -> P BinNums.xH -> forall p : BinNums.positive, P p
Znat.Nat2Z.is_nonneg : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)

```coq
intros H1 H2.
pose (n := proj1_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)).
exists n.
split.
- apply (proj2_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)).
- intros i Hi.
  assert (i < n \/ i = n) as [H | H] by (apply le_lt_or_eq; assumption).
  + apply (proj2_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)) in H.
    contradiction.
  + subst i.
    apply (proj2_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)).
Qed.

original: intros H1 H2. pose (n := proj1_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)). exists n. split. - apply (proj2_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)). - intros i Hi. assert (i < n \/ i = n) as [H | H] by (apply le_lt_or_eq; assumption). + apply (proj2_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)) in H. contradiction. + subst i. apply (proj2_sig (dec_inh_nat_subset_has_unique_least_element P H1 H2)).
